description: [Nile Post] Africa is taking major steps toward self-sufficiency in vaccine and health product manufacturing, as leaders, manufacturers, and global partners gathered at the 2nd Vaccine &amp; Health Products Manufacturing Forum in Cairo, Egypt.
title: Africa: Africa Moves Towards Self-Sufficiency in Vaccine and Health Product Manufacturing

description: [Nile Post] Ms Mulinge, who took the reins at MTN Uganda in 2022, received this prestigious accolade at the MTN Global Leadership Gathering (GLG) gala dinner held in Johannesburg, South Africa, on Thursday evening.
title: Africa: Sylvia Mulinge Crowned Best CEO of MTN Across Africa

description: [Premium Times] The sanction also affects anyone assisting the ICC with its investigation of the US or its allies.
title: Africa: ICC, Others React As U.S. Sanctions International Criminal Court

description: [ISS] As M23 continues its destructive march, the EAC-SADC summit must consider lessons from failed peace efforts.
title: Africa: Eastern DRC - Unpacking the Difficult Task of Regional Diplomacy

description: [IAS] The good news first: HIV science has made remarkable progress. While we still lack a vaccine or cure, a single dose of     a new long-acting injectable drug can now offer protection against HIV for up to six months    . This breakthrough could revolutionize efforts to curb a pandemic that still claims a life every minute. However, the rise of populism and regressive governance threatens to unravel many hard-won gains in HIV and public health.
title: Africa: Why HIV Could Be Poised for a Monumental Comeback

description: [UN News] Some 230 million girls in more than 90 countries - predominantly in Africa and Asia - have undergone female genital mutilation (FGM) and can suffer lifelong physical, emotional and psychological scars, an issue that the UN's sexual and reproductive health agency has been tackling with the support of the international community including the United States.
title: Africa: 'She Had a Syringe, Razor Blade, and Bandages' - Surviving Genital Mutilation

description: [CAF] With just months to go before African clubs take on the world's best at the FIFA Club World Cup in the United States; the new FIFA Club World Cup trophy made its way to African soil as part of the tournament's build up ahead of kick-off.
title: Africa: FIFA Club World Cup Trophy Touches Down On African Soil

description: [Leadership] President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has charged African leaders to stop clinging to their old habit of depending on foreign plans, saying the continent needs leaders who wield policy as a surgical blade instead of a slogan.
title: Africa: Africa Can't Progress By Clinging to Foreign Blueprints - Tinubu

description: [The Conversation Africa] About 5% of people who catch COVID have long-lasting symptoms. In these people, loss of smell, dizziness, fatigue and other hallmark COVID symptoms can persist for months after the initial illness. Yet even five years after the COVID pandemic began, we still don't know why some people develop long COVID and others don't.
title: Africa: Long Covid - Women At Greater Risk Compared to Men - Could Immune System Differences Be the Cause?

description: [Afropop] Paul Beaubrun descends from Haitian music royalty. His parents, Lolo and Mimerose Beaubrun, are the founders and leaders of the legendary racine band Boukman Eksperyans. Paul broke out on his own with his second album Ayibobo(2018), featured on Afropop's From Haiti to the World, and the subject of many rave reiews. He followed up with Rasanbleman (Red Moon) in 2020. Paul also played an integra role in Jackson Brown's Artists for Peace and Justice project in Haiti, which resulted in a remarkable
title: Africa: Paul Beaubrun Shines Light From Haiti

description: [Global Press Journal] Kampala, Uganda -- As US President Donald Trump ends nearly all foreign aid funding, access to medicines that have suppressed an epidemic for decades will disappear.
title: Africa: Ugandans Fear Resurgence of Aids As Health Clinics Close

description: [UN News] As the world marks the International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation on Thursday, the United Nations is warning that without urgent action, a staggering 27 million more girls could undergo the procedure by 2030.
title: Africa: 'Step Up the Pace' and End Female Genital Mutilation, UN Says

description: [Afrobarometer] One in four citizens report going without basic necessities on a frequent basis.
title: Africa: Decade of Destitution? Severe Lived Poverty Is Surging in Many African Countries

description: [UN News] The world has just experienced the hottest January ever recorded, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) said on Thursday, citing data crunched by UN partner the Copernicus Climate Service
title: Africa: It's Official - January Was the Warmest On Record
